qas.question: Who did the BBC in 2008 report as using child labor?
What did the BBC program make their viewers question?

answers.text: "Why am I only paying £4 for a hand embroidered top?

qas.question: What else did the BBC expose?

answers.text: the violent side of the child labour industry

context: In 2008, the BBC reported that the company <a0_0>Primark<a0_0/> was using child labor in the manufacture of <a1_0>clothing<a1_0/>. In particular, a £4 hand-embroidered shirt was the starting point of a documentary produced by BBC's Panorama programme. The programme asks consumers to ask themselves, <a2_0>"Why am I only paying £4 for a hand embroidered top?<a2_0/> This item looks handmade. Who made it for such little cost?", in addition to exposing <a3_0>the violent side of the child labour industry<a3_0/> in countries where child exploitation is prevalent.
